comment.author: 99500904@N07
comment._content: this photo may be taken from Ma Liu Shui, one of the train depot in Kowloon-Canton Railway ( the railway can be seen in the bottom of photo ) ~  the far apart hills at the other side of the sea may be Ma On Shan ( right ) and Pat Sin Leng near Tai Po ( left ) ~  if that's the exact place i mentioned, this picture should be taken in around 1907-1910

comment._content: It might not be Hong Kong.

comment._content: The hill on the right didn't look like Ma On Shan.

comment.author: 13496834@N08
comment._content: Look, lots of rail tracks. it seems not KCRC railway.

comment.author: 61013804@N08
comment._content: The rail pattern is more like a dockyard. The hills do not look like Pat Sin Range or Ma On Shan. I don't think it is Ma Liu Shui. There seems to be a bay on the right extending out, which is not present at Ma Liu Shui
